column4: does ubuntu use the same file system as the host if it's running in virtualbox?
it better NOT do. Thats' "not supported"
what's better not do...running it in virtualbox?
err, you don't use the host's filesystem as the root filesystem of the virtualbox instance.
IConrad01: ok, well, I installed virtualbox on vista, and then ubuntu on virtualbox, which runs fine...except I can't do a sym link
IConrad01: no, sym link within ubuntu. I installed phpmyadmin. it ended up in /usr/share and I need it sym linked to /var/www ... I get the message, despite sudo, that the action is not permitted
hm. Sounds like you have other errors.
well, i was reading a lot of messages about sym links not working in a fat32 partition... and i could think of no reason why linux would be on a fat32 partition other than a situation like mine
it's got /var/run and /var/lock, both none on tmpfs
it accepted the command, but no output from it
I have a directory from Vista mounted to /var/www ... would that matter?
IConrad01: that was it. I unmounted the vista directory, restarted ubuntu, and the symlink worked
